content: What 19th-century author created the character of Natty Bumppo, a frontiersman who appears in five novels known as the Leatherstocking Tales?

The author who created the character of Natty Bumppo, also known as Leatherstocking, is James Fenimore Cooper. He was an American writer who lived in the 19th century, specifically from 1789 to 1851. Cooper is often regarded as one of the first major novelists from the United States, and his Leatherstocking Tales are among his most famous works.

Natty Bumppo is the protagonist in a series of five novels that depict life in the frontier regions of early America. These novels are:

1. **"The Deerslayer"** (1841) - Set in the 1740s, it is the first in the series chronologically and introduces Natty Bumppo as a young man.

2. **"The Last of the Mohicans"** (1826) - Probably the most famous of the series, set during the French and Indian War in the 1750s.

3. **"The Prairie"** (1827) - Set in the 1790s on the western frontier, it features an older Natty Bumppo.

4. **"The Pathfinder"** (1840) - Takes place during the French and Indian War, similar to "The Last of the Mohicans."

5. **"The Pioneers"** (1823) - The first published novel in the series, set in 1793, depicting life in upstate New York.

These novels not only showcase Natty Bumppo's adventures and moral struggles but also provide insights into the relationship between settlers and Native Americans, as well as the encroachment of civilization on the wilderness. Cooper's works were influential in shaping the image of the American frontier and have had a lasting impact on literature and popular culture.
